member.name: T:Microsoft.JSInterop.DotNetObjectReference
member.summary: Provides convenience methods to produce a .

member.name: M:Microsoft.JSInterop.DotNetObjectReference.Create``1(``0)
member.summary: Creates a new instance of .
member.param: The reference type to track.
member.returns: An instance of .

member.name: T:Microsoft.JSInterop.DotNetObjectReference`1
member.summary:
Wraps a JS interop argument, indicating that the value should not be serialized as JSON but instead should be passed as a reference.
To avoid leaking memory, the reference must later be disposed by JS code or by .NET code.
member.typeparam: The type of the value to wrap.

member.name: M:Microsoft.JSInterop.DotNetObjectReference`1.#ctor(`0)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of .
member.param: The value to pass by reference.

member.name: P:Microsoft.JSInterop.DotNetObjectReference`1.Value
member.summary: Gets the object instance represented by this wrapper.

member.name: M:Microsoft.JSInterop.DotNetObjectReference`1.Dispose
member.summary: Stops tracking this object reference, allowing it to be garbage collected (if there are no other references to it). Once the instance is disposed, it can no longer be used in interop calls from JavaScript code.

member.name: T:Microsoft.JSInterop.DotNetStreamReference
member.summary: Represents the reference to a .NET stream sent to JavaScript.

member.summary: Create a reference to a .NET stream sent to JavaScript.

member.summary: The stream being sent to JavaScript.

member.name: P:Microsoft.JSInterop.DotNetStreamReference.LeaveOpen
member.summary: A flag that indicates whether the stream should be left open after transmission.

Invokes the specified JavaScript function asynchronously.
will apply timeouts to this operation based on the value configured in . To dispatch a call with a different, or no timeout, consider using .
member.typeparam: The JSON-serializable return type.
member.param: An identifier for the function to invoke. For example, the value "someScope.someFunction" will invoke the function someScope.someFunction on the target instance.

A cancellation token to signal the cancellation of the operation. Specifying this parameter will override any default cancellations such as due to timeouts () from being applied.
JSON-serializable arguments.
member.returns: An instance of obtained by JSON-deserializing the return value.

member.name: T:Microsoft.JSInterop.IJSUnmarshalledRuntime
member.summary: Represents an instance of a JavaScript runtime to which calls may be dispatched without JSON marshalling. Not all JavaScript runtimes support this capability. Currently it is only supported on WebAssembly and for security reasons, will never be supported for .NET code that runs on the server. This is an advanced mechanism that should only be used in performance-critical scenarios.

member.name: M:Microsoft.JSInterop.Infrastructure.DotNetDispatcher.BeginInvokeDotNet(Microsoft.JSInterop.JSRuntime,Microsoft.JSInterop.Infrastructure.DotNetInvocationInfo,System.String)
member.summary: Receives a call from JS to .NET, locating and invoking the specified method asynchronously.
member.param: The .
The .
A JSON representation of the parameters.
member.returns: A JSON representation of the return value, or null.

member.name: M:Microsoft.JSInterop.Infrastructure.DotNetDispatcher.EndInvokeJS(Microsoft.JSInterop.JSRuntime,System.String)
member.summary: Receives notification that a call from .NET to JS has finished, marking the associated as completed.
member.remarks: All exceptions from are caught are delivered via JS interop to the JavaScript side when it requests confirmation, as the mechanism to call relies on using JS->.NET interop. This overload is meant for directly triggering completion callbacks for .NET -> JS operations without going through JS interop, so the callsite for this method is responsible for handling any possible exception generated from the arguments passed in as parameters.
member.param: The .
The serialized arguments for the callback completion.
member.exception: This method can throw any exception either from the argument received or as a result of executing any callback synchronously upon completion.

member.summary: Accepts the byte array data being transferred from JS to DotNet.

member.name: T:Microsoft.JSInterop.Infrastructure.ArrayBuilder`1
member.summary:
Implements a list that uses an array of objects to store the elements.
This differs from a in that it not only grows as required but also shrinks if cleared with significant excess capacity. This makes it useful for component rendering, because components can be long-lived and re-render frequently, with the rendered size varying dramatically depending on the user's navigation in the app.

member.name: M:Microsoft.JSInterop.Infrastructure.ArrayBuilder`1.#ctor(System.Int32,System.Buffers.ArrayPool{`0})
member.summary: Constructs a new instance of .

member.returns: The index of the appended item.

The value.

member.name: M:Microsoft.JSInterop.Infrastructure.ArrayBuilder`1.Clear
member.summary: Marks the array as empty, also shrinking the underlying storage if it was not being used to near its full capacity.

member.name: T:Microsoft.JSInterop.JSInvokableAttribute

Gets the identifier for the method. The identifier must be unique within the scope of an assembly.
